Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please could you respond to the following questions, regarding highways delivery.
-	Do you use contractors or self-deliver highways maintenance for your local authority?
-	If a contractor is used for a PFI contract, when did this contract commence and when does it end?
-      Have you considered using innovated materials to fix road defects?
-	Which highways maintenance contractors and sub contractors do you (or your wider main contractor) use and what activity are they responsible for?
-	What plant machinery is used in your highways maintenance, both yours and your contractors / rental partners?
-	What measurement criteria is used to assess the contractor’s performance? How have they performed over a 12 month period?
-	What is the spending and workforce associated to each of the following – planned highways maintenance, reactive highways maintenance, capital schemes?
-	Who is the individual(s) that assess the assets and machinery used in your highway maintenance?
-      Do you provide your own PPE?
-	What measurement do you use to identify the longevity of the highways maintenance fix?
-	What innovation have you trailed for highway maintenance?
Yours faithfully,
Tom Hobbs

Dear Tom Hobbs,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Highways

The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 state that we must respond
to you within 20 working days, by 01/10/2024. Please do not hesitate to
contact us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,

Dear Tom Hobbs,
Thank you for your recent clarification relating to highways maintenance
which we received on 16/09/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
Do you use contractors or self-deliver highways maintenance for your local
authority?
Sheffield City Council has a Private Finance Initiative contract with Amey
Hallam Highways Ltd for the delivery of a complete highway maintenance
service which includes all highway maintenance activities such as street
lighting, street cleaning, carriageway and footway resurfacing, signal
maintenance, etc.
If a contractor is used for a PFI contract, when did this contract
commence and when does it end?
Commenced August 2012 and ends August 2037.
Have you considered using innovated materials to fix road defects?
Yes
Which highways maintenance contractors and sub-contractors do you (or your
wider main contractor) use and what activity are they responsible for?
Amey is currently responsible for all highway maintenance activities.
Sub-contractors are used to support with specialist maintenance activities
where required, however, Amey remains responsible for any highway sites.
What plant machinery is used in your highways maintenance, both yours and
your contractors / rental partners?
Whacker plate
JCB
Roller
Stihl Saw
Breaker
Cat and Genny
What measurement criteria is used to assess the contractor’s performance?
How have they performed over a 12-month period?
The contractor's performance is measured against an Output Specification
which is made up of 10 Service Standards containing various Performance
Requirements.  Details of the Output Specification are published here:
[1]Streets Ahead documents | Sheffield City Council
We would like to clarify how to respond to the second part of this
question. The contractor is measured against a set of Performance
Requirements; there are several hundred of these. Do you require
information regarding performance at the macro level or do you require
information regarding performance against each of those Performance
Requirements?  Also, whatever information is provided, which 12-month
period would you like information for? We will treat your response as a
new request.
What is the spending and workforce associated to each of the following –
planned highways maintenance, reactive highways maintenance, capital
schemes?
Sheffield City Council has a Private Finance Initiative contract with Amey
Hallam Highways Ltd for the delivery of a complete highway maintenance
service which includes all highway maintenance activities such as street
lighting, street cleaning, carriageway and footway resurfacing, signal
maintenance etc.  Payments made by the Council under the contract do not
relate to the provision of specific items of work.  Instead, a single
payment is made for each month of the 25-year term of the contract.  As a
result, we do not have a figure for the costs incurred by Amey for
individual operations.
Who is the individual(s) that assess the assets and machinery used in your
highway maintenance?
Principal Operations Manager for Assets
Highways Delivery Manager & Operations Manager for Highway Maintenance
delivery and machinery
Do you provide your own PPE?
Amey provides PPE for all Highways Maintenance employees.
What measurement do you use to identify the longevity of the highways
maintenance fix?
Regular Condition Surveys and Safety Inspections are completed to identify
sites requiring short/longer term repairs. Amey also responds to reports
from members of the public.  All defects noted and subsequent repairs
completed, are recorded to allow for any long-term monitoring.
What innovation have you trailed for highway maintenance? (Over past 5
years)
Thermo-Active road repair treatment
Road Mender Asphalt
Retread road surface treatment
Ralumac road surface treatment
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.

found [2]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council

be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you

for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council

Sheffield, S1 1UJ
